Package pacman.model

Class Score

  • java.lang.Object
    • pacman.model.Score
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Score
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    Score

    A Score is an object to keep the record of the play's score in a single run.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Song Zhang
    See Also:
    ScoreBoard, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Score

        public Score​(java.lang.String nickname)
        Allocates a new Score object.

        This constructor initializes the value to 0, records the nickname and sets the time to the current time.

        Parameters:
        nickname - the player's nickname.

      • Score

        public Score()
        Allocates a new Score object.

        This constructor does the same thing as Score does, but with a default nickname "Unknown Player" initialized.

    • Method Detail

      • gain

        public void gain​(int value)
        Increases the value by the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - an integer to be added to the value.

      • lose

        public void lose​(int value)
        Decreases the value by the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - an integer to be added to the value.

      • settle

        public void settle()
        Settles the score. That is: changes the time to the current time.

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Returns the value.
        Returns:
        an integer indicating the value of score.

      • getNickname

        public java.lang.String getNickname()
        Returns the player's nickname.
        Returns:
        the player's nickname.

      • getTime

        public java.util.Date getTime()
        Returns the time when the Score is settled.
        Returns:
        the time when the Score is settled.
